item.title: What Even Is A Container And A Kubernetes Pod
item.description: Container The word container doesn’t mean anything super precise. Basically there are a few new Linux kernel features (namespaces and cgroups) that let you isolate processes from each other. When you use those features, you call it containers. Basically these features let you pretend you have something like a virtual machine, except it’s not a virtual machine at all, it’s just processes running in the same Linux kernel. Namespaces namespaces is a Linux feature which could separate your processes from the other processes on the same computer.
